creator: huw@pobox.com
text:
In earlier versions of log4j the properties file for log4j was found
by going (in Category.java):
  ClassLoader loader = org.log4j.Category.class.getClassLoader(); //...
  URL url = loader.getResource(DEFAULT_PROPERTIES_FILE);
but now it's found by going (in Category.java and Loader.java):
  Loader.getResource(resource, Object.class /* == clazz */); 
  url = clazz.getResource(resource);

This means that when I run under tomcat, which uses a different class loader
for different webapps, I now cannot find the log4j.properties file for my
webapp, instead I find a system wide one because I'm using the class loader
for Object.

It would be better if the Category object went:
  Loader.getResource(resource, org.log4j.Category.class);
which would use the class loader used to load this Category and would
be backwards compatible.
